Row.Text: We have Delegate support to trade.
We have no Delegate support to trade.
They have Delegate support to trade.
They have no Delegate support to trade.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Trades cannot be made when the World Congress is in session.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]World Congress has not been founded yet.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]We need a Spy as a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat in their [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They need a Spy as a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat in our [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Not a member of the World Congress.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]No proposals have been made yet for this World Congress session.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Already traded Delegates to a Civilization for this World Congress session.[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Already committed the Delegates for this World Congress session.[ENDCOLOR]

In the next World Congress session, this leader will use its core delegation of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumVotes}[ENDCOLOR] {1_NumVotes: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;} to support {2_ChoiceText} on the proposal to [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]enact[ENDCOLOR] these changes:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_ProposalText}

In the next World Congress session, this leader will use its core delegation of [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_NumVotes}[ENDCOLOR] {1_NumVotes: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;} to support {2_ChoiceText} on the proposal to [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]repeal[ENDCOLOR] these effects:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]{3_ProposalText}
Choose a new name for the World Congress
Turns until next World Leader proposal: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_DelegatesForWin}[ENDCOLOR]
Delegates to win World Leader proposal: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{1_DelegatesForWin}[ENDCOLOR]

Since the World Congress has become the United Nations, Diplomatic Victory is now possible. To win it, a Civilization must receive the support of {1_DelegatesForWin} or more Delegates on a World Leader proposal. This number is based on the number of Civilizations and City-States in the game.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The World Leader proposal is made to the Congress every other session, alternating with regular sessions about regular proposals.
{@1_LeaderName} of {@2_CivName} commands a total of {3_VotesRemaining} {3_VotesRemaining: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;}. Once in session, the amount is fixed until the session ends.
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_NumVotes} from researching Globalization ({2_VotesPerDiplomat} per Spy assigned as a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat)
[COLOR_GREY]You may not make this proposal at this time.[ENDCOLOR]
[COLOR_GREY]This choice for the proposal is already under consideration, and may not be proposed again.[ENDCOLOR]
May not be proposed by a Civilization.
Not allowed by this game's options.
No available choices for this resolution to affect.
Resolutions that will be decided in the next session. The outcome will be the choice with the most Delegate support from Civilizations. In a tie, the Resolution will fail and nothing will change.
Resolutions that are currently in effect, which Civilizations may attempt to repeal.
Resolutions that Civilizations may attempt to enact.
Resolutions that cannot be proposed at this time.
They will be able to make a proposal next session because the privilege rotates, and it is their turn.
They will be able to make a proposal next session because they are the host Civilization. If the host changes by the end of this session, the new host will make a proposal instead.

They will be able to make a proposal next session because they are the non-host Civilization with the most Delegates. If that changes by the end of this session, the new non-host Civilization with the most Delegates will make a proposal instead.
Click here to propose a resolution.
These are the current effects happening because of the World Congress. They will change as new Resolutions are enacted or old Resolutions are repealed.
-{1_ResearchCostPercent}% [ICON_RESEARCH] Research cost for Technologies already discovered by another Civilization
+{1_NumCulture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from every Great Person tile improvement
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]Some of your Delegates are not assigned.[ENDCOLOR] Do you want to commit anyway?
This proposal is on hold until the World Congress concludes its Special Session.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]We have some understanding of their goals.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]We have intimate knowledge of their agenda.
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]We have a Spy as a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat in their [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]We do not have a Spy as a [ICON_DIPLOMAT] Diplomat in their [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]We do not have a Declaration of Friendship[ENDCOLOR]
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Their top choices for the current proposals:
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Because of a trade deal, they have agreed to commit {3_NumDelegates} {3_NumDelegates: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;} to support {2_VoteChoice} on {1_Proposal}.
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Based on our knowledge of other Civilizations' desires, our count for this proposal stands at:

[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{3_VoteChoice}: {2_NumCivs} {2_NumCivs: plural 1?Civilization has; other?Civilizations have;} committed {1_NumDelegates} {1_NumDelegates: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;} because of trade deals
[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_NumCivs} {2_NumCivs: plural 1?Civilization; other?Civilizations;} controlling {1_NumDelegates} {1_NumDelegates: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;} unaccounted for
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Civilizations that would be grateful if we proposed this:
[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Civilizations that would be angry if we proposed this:
This project requires a total of [ICON_PRODUCTION] {1_TotalCost} Production between all Civilizations to be completed. Higher contributions earn more rewards:

This project is {1_PercentComplete}% completed. So far, your Civilization has contributed [ICON_PRODUCTION] [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PlayerContribution}[ENDCOLOR]. Higher contributions will earn more rewards:

{@1_CivName} has discovered every Civilization in the world. To commemorate this occurrence, leaders from around the world will come together in the {2_LeagueName} in {3_TurnsUntilSession} Turns to begin discussing international diplomacy. As Civilizations advance into later eras, this Congress will change and new hosts may be chosen.
The world has entered the {@1_EraName}, either because half of the Civilizations have reached it or one Civilization has reached the era beyond it.
The World Congress has not yet been founded. It will begin once one Civilization has discovered {@1_TechName} and met every Civilization in the game.
The World Congress is disabled for this game.

It is your turn to make a proposal for the {1_LeagueName} to consider. You may propose to enact a new resolution, or repeal an existing resolution. You and the other members of the {1_LeagueName} will decide the outcome of your proposal in the next session.
The {1_LeagueName} is now in session, and your delegation awaits your command. Distribute your Delegates amongst the proposed resolutions to support the outcomes that work best for your Civilization.
The proposed resolutions to the {1_LeagueName} have been decided on.
Garnering the required support of at least {1_NumDelegates} {1_NumDelegates: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;}, {@2_CivName} has been chosen as the World Leader.

Without a clear winner garnering the support of at least {1_NumDelegates} {1_NumDelegates: plural 1?Delegate; other?Delegates;}, the World Leader proposal fails. The top {2_NumCivilizations} {2_NumCivilizations: plural 1?Civilization has; other?Civilizations have;} permanently gained additional Delegates.
The Special Session of the {1_LeagueName} has chosen {@2_CivName} to be the next host.
{1_ResolutionName} was passed. Its effects are [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]now active[ENDCOLOR].
{1_ResolutionName} was passed. Its effects are [COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]no longer active[ENDCOLOR].
The {1_LeagueName} will convene in {2_TurnsUntilSession} turns to deliberate on proposed resolutions:

The {@1_ProjectName} project is now [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]{2_PercentComplete}[ENDCOLOR]% complete. To contribute towards its completion and earn rewards, choose the project in the city production list.
Leaders from around the world come together in the World Congress to begin discussing international affairs. Their first order of business is to determine who will host the Congress.

City-States find their place on the world stage and formally enter international diplomacy. Civilizations now receive additional delegates from having City-State allies. Amidst this change, the World Congress calls a special session to determine the next host of the Congress.
The voices of nations large and small fight to be heard and international affairs become more complex. A special session is called to choose the next host to lead the Congress forward.

The fledgling idea of a permanent peace takes root in the World Congress, which is reborn as the United Nations. A special session to is called to choose the host of this powerful new diplomatic force. The United Nations will continue to decide matters as before, but regular sessions will alternate with sessions attempting to choose a World Leader, making [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Diplomatic Victory[ENDCOLOR] possible.

Designate a World Leader. If a Civilization receives support from enough Delegates in the Congress, that leader will attain [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Diplomatic Victory[ENDCOLOR]. The number of Delegates needed depends on the number of Civilizations and City-States in the game, and can be seen on the World Congress screen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If no Civilization receives enough support to win, the two Civilizations who received the most support permanently gain [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]2 additional Delegates[ENDCOLOR] to use in future sessions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be proposed by a Civilization. Automatically proposed at regular intervals once the World Congress becomes the United Nations.

Designate a Civilization to host the Congress. Being the host grants additional Delegates and the ability to propose resolutions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be proposed by a Civilization. Automatically proposed as Civilizations advance to later eras.
All members get a one time increase of 100 [ICON_GOLD] Gold. Repealing has no effect.
City-State [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence decays more rapidly, but [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes with City-States generate additional [ICON_GOLD].
All members get 2 of a resource as long as this resolution remains active.

All non-City-State members contribute 20% of their [ICON_GOLD] Gold reserves to aid City-State members. Negative City-State relations are reset to 0 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence. Repealing has no effect.
No [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes can be established with City-States. Any such Trade Routes are ended and must be reassigned.
No [ICON_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Routes can be established between the chosen Civilization and any other Civilization. Any such Trade Routes are ended and must be reassigned.

A Luxury resource is designated as immoral, endangered, or otherwise inappropriate for use by the general population. As long as the ban is in place, Civilizations receive no [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness benefit from this Luxury resource.
Unit maintenance costs are raised by 25% [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Civilizations research a technology 20% more quickly if it has been discovered by at least one other Civilization.

Begins the International Space Station project. Once underway, Civilizations can contribute [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards its completion by selecting it in the city production list. When complete, Civilizations receive bonuses based on how much they contributed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_GOLD]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_ISS_3_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_SILVER]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_ISS_2_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_BRONZE]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_ISS_1_HELP}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Satellites.
Each World Wonder provides +3 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to its city.
Each Natural Wonder provides +5 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture when worked.

Begins the World's Fair project. Once underway, Civilizations can contribute [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards its completion by selecting it in the city production list. When complete, Civilizations receive bonuses based on how much they contributed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_GOLD]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_WORLD_FAIR_3_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_SILVER]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_WORLD_FAIR_2_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_BRONZE]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_WORLD_FAIR_1_HELP}

Begins the International Games project. Once underway, Civilizations can contribute [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards its completion by selecting it in the city production list. When complete, Civilizations receive bonuses based on how much they contributed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_GOLD]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_WORLD_GAMES_3_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_SILVER]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_WORLD_GAMES_2_HELP}[NEWLINE][ICON_TROPHY_BRONZE]: {TXT_KEY_LEAGUE_PROJECT_REWARD_WORLD_GAMES_1_HELP}[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Radio.

All Civilizations are prevented from constructing new nuclear weapons (Atomic Bomb and Nuclear Missile). Weapons already constructed, however, are not disarmed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Advanced Ballistics.

Designate a religion as the official World Religion. Civilizations who have a majority of the cities in their empire following the religion get an additional 2 Delegates. The religion spreads 25% faster, and its Holy City receives +50% [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism. There can only be one World Religion at a time.

Designate an Ideology as the official World Ideology. Civilizations following that Ideology get an additional 2 Delegates. Public opinion in favor of that Ideology is increased for all Civilizations. There can only be one World Ideology at a time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Radio.
Increases generation of Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians by 33%. Decreases generation of Great Scientists, Engineers, and Merchants by 33%.
Increases generation of Great Scientists, Engineers, and Merchants by 33%. Decreases generation of Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians by 33%.

Great Person tile improvements provide +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture when worked, and Landmarks built by Archaeologists provide +4 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture when worked.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Available once any Civilization discovers Archaeology.
Choose a Member for the Resolution to affect
Choose a City for the Resolution to affect
Choose a Luxury Resource for the Resolution to affect
Choose whether to repeal this Resolution
Choose a Civilization for the Resolution to affect
Choose a Civilization other than your own for the Resolution to affect
Choose a Civilization with a large delegation ({1_NumDelegates} or more Delegates)
Choose a Religion for the Resolution to affect
Choose an Ideology for the Resolution to affect
The International Space Station has been completed and launched into outer space, marking a new frontier in the achievement of humankind.
Thinkers and inventors from around the world have come together to share their ideas in the extravagant World's Fair.

Athletes representing Civilizations from around the world have gathered to compete in feats of strength, skill, and grace. As the world watches, Civilizations rise to glory with each medal earned in the International Games.
Did not contribute enough to the project to earn any reward.
International Space Station wonder appears in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital. ({TXT_KEY_BUILDING_INTERNATIONAL_SPACE_STATION_HELP})
+3 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness. One time increase of 30 [ICON_INFLUENCE] Influence with City-States.
[ICON_TOURISM] Tourism increases by 100% for 20 Turns. Free Social Policy.
